instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3787 random row of keys not working
threads.message:
This is the same board that I just got help with fixing due to internal speakers not working. [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/33982-820-3787-no-audio-output-or-input-bluetooth-sound-works"]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards...th-sound-works[/URL]

That issue is fixed but now I am having issues with a row of keys that are not working. "zxcvbnm,." those keys are not working and I plugged in another new keyboard of mines and the same keys on that one didn't work either. When I plugged in a usb keyboard those keys were registering from usb keyboard.
I've done an SMC and PRAM reset already.

Also the keyboard backlight is not turning on in the OS even though I am to toggle the keyboard backlight from the keyboard but no light appears on the keyboard.

I've removed the SSD and booted into my OS on a USB stick but that didn't solve the issue either.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3787 random row of keys not working
threads.message:
Connector issue. 

Backlight is probably also messed up connector or torn cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3787 random row of keys not working
threads.message:
Replaced connector and now keyboard is working fine. The Backlight cable wasn't plugged as I thought it was because i mistook the microphone cable for the kbd backlight cable.

Everything is all fine now. Thanks again Duke.
